text.p: Seven analysts polled by Reuters have downgraded Norsk Hydro's projected Earnings Per Share for 1996 by 7.2 percent following the presentation of the company's third-quarter results on Monday.
On the average, the analysts now forecast a 1996 EPS of 25.70 crowns, down from a previous estimate of 27.70 crowns.
The adjustment was due mainly to a writedown of 400 million crowns from a downward revision of estimates for remaining oil and gas reserves in the North Sea Frigg area.
Hydro, Norway's largest listed company, on Monday blamed lower prices for aluminium and petrochemicals for a 45 percent slump in third-quarter net profits.
The diversified industrial group reported profits after tax of 909 million crowns for the three months to September 30 against 1.66 billion crowns in the same 1995 period.
The analysts stuck to their recommendations on the share, which were five buy, one hold and one sell.
